definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The women my mother denigrated were the ones urging me towards independence.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲所诋毁的女士们都敦促我走向独立。

sentences.english: Another is his birthplace - some of the president's detractors question the veracity of Mr. Obama's Hawaiian birth certificate.
sentences.chinese: 一些诋毁者对他夏威夷出生证的真实性提出了质疑。

sentences.english: You shouldn't denigrate people just because they have different beliefs from you.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该仅仅因为人们的信仰和你不同就诋毁他们。

sentences.english: He was basely slandered by his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他受到仇敌卑鄙的诋毁。

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉费心机地写文章诋毁这场运动。

sentences.english: The essence of the denigration of women is our definition as sex object.
sentences.chinese: 诋毁妇女的实质就是视我们为性目标。

sentences.english: Two chose not to vilify Skilling, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，也有两个人并不愿诋毁思斯奇林。

sentences.english: She accused the programme of slurring the company's name.
sentences.chinese: 她指责这个节目诋毁公司的声誉。

sentences.english: Power is the great corrupter of politics, business– and marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治名誉由于他的非法婚姻而受到诋毁。

sentences.english: He even vowed to take across people who slandered him so that they would accomplish Buddhahood before he did.
sentences.chinese: 甚至誓愿度一切诋毁辱骂他的人比自己更早成佛。

sentences.english: There is nowhere in the article that science is denigrated or devalued, as far as I can see.
sentences.chinese: 就我看来，文中丝毫没有诋毁或贬低科学的意思。

sentences.english: Like any politician, Renho has had her detractors.
sentences.chinese: 像所有政治人物一样，莲舫也曾遭人诋毁。

sentences.english: No such slur is permitted in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在北京这样的诋毁是不允许的。

sentences.english: He angrily accused the investigators of slandering both him and his family.
sentences.chinese: 他气愤地指责调查者诋毁他和他的家人。

sentences.english: He claims he was slandered at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他声称在会上受人诋毁。

definition: variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
